meanings.definition: Circulated as an unverified account or report.
meanings.sent1: The rumoured about the new movie spread quickly through the town.
meanings.sent2: The rumoured of a treasure hidden in the old house excited everyone.
meanings.sent3: The rumoured of a ghost haunting the school turned out to be a prank.
meanings.sent4: The rumoured of a secret passage in the castle added an air of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The rumoured of a UFO landing in the field captured everyone's imagination.

meanings.definition: Gossiped about; discussed in a speculative manner.
meanings.sent1: The rumoured story of the missing cat was the talk of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She was always surrounded by rumoured tales of her past adventures.
meanings.sent3: The rumoured party at the mayor's house turned out to be a surprise birthday celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her rumoured relationship with the famous actor made headlines.
meanings.sent5: The rumoured treasure hidden in the forest was a topic of heated discussion.
